   leukocytosis and imaging findings in the context of a history of
   chronic aspiration and most of infiltrates in the dependent lung areas
   (vs hospital/health care associated pneumonia given recent
   hospitalization). Imaging suggests a multifocal pneumonia.  Patient was
   unexpectedly extubated last night, but has done well post-extubation
   maintaining O2 sats and appears comfortable on high flow mask.
   Speciation from sputum is still pending.  Urine Legionella antigen is
   negative.

   may need to add for atypical coverage.  Reassuring that fevers have
   subsided and WBC count is trending downward.

   negative, low suspicion for MI.

   Minimal old notes in our system but his heart rate was 50-80s per those
   records.  Initial bradycardia could be secondary to neosynepherine or
   sepsis causing sick sinus vs concern for bacteremia and endocarditis vs
   just sinus bradycardia. QTc is also mildly prolonged.  Bradycardia is
   now resolved.
   .

   presentation likely related to infection.  Head CT showed no acute

   was extubated.
